intro: Crithmum canariense, commonly known as Canary thyme, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, herbaceous foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
